title: Why do This Morning and Loose Women keep being cancelled?
text:
Liz Hurley and Lauren Mahon have been among the guests on This Morning so far this week (Picture: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

This Morning fans will have a slightly prolonged wait to see Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield interview more special guests and chat about the big topics of the day, as the show is taking a short break from ITV’s schedule.

Tuesday’s show saw Lisa Snowdon on the sofa, offering tips and tricks needed to make a sartorial impact in autumn and beyond.

Juliet Sear was in the kitchen, explaining how to give the traditional chocolate Swiss roll recipe a Halloween makeover at home, and there was a glamorous section featuring Victoria Beckham sharing her biggest make-up fails.

So why isn’t the show screening on Wednesday and when is it back?

Why isn’t This Morning on today and when is it back?

Wales take on Fiji in the Rugby World Cup in Japan today, and ITV has the rights to show the game live.

Coverage of the match runs throughout the morning, meaning This Morning will make way for Sam Warburton, Gareth Thomas and Jamie Roberts as they follow Wales’s World Cup progress live.

The Pool C clash takes over the schedule until 1.30pm, so Loose Women, which usually follows This Morning, is also cancelled today.

The good news for This Morning fans is that the show will be back on Thursday, when features include an interview with Sienna Miller about her new film, American Woman.

Loose Women will also be back straight after This Morning, with no further Rugby World Cup interruptions planned for the schedule between now and the end of next week.

It’s not the first time This Morning and Loose Women have been cancelled lately because of the Rugby World Cup, but given the final is on 2 November, fans of the morning TV shows won’t have to put up with the disruptions for too much longer.

description: Why are This Morning and Loose Women cancelled? Find out why the hit ITV shows are taking a temporary break from the air.
